home.name: Lucila V. Kendziur
home.resume: Hi! I'm Lu, a front-end developer from Argentina. I relish when facing challenges as they allow me to learn a little more every day. Teamwork, code documentation, and accessibility are the three utmost important pillars of my work. Furthermore, I believe that I stand out for developing user interfaces that are accessible to everyone as in this ever growing world it is even more important to enable people with diverse abilities and methods to access effectively and efficiently breaking down the barriers.
home.card-description-1: In addition to being a programmer, I have a degree in Political Science from the National University of Rosario.
home.card-description-2: I discovered my passion for systems in college, while doing the functional part of an app.
home.card-description-3: I’m a cat enthusiast. Saul and Sultan are my great office companions.

about.title: About
about.description: I started in the world of software development in 2021 as a NetSuite Developer, which allowed me to have a very strong foundation in vanilla JavaScript and understand the close relationship between client and server. In 2022 I decided to take on a new challenge in the development world and thus I started working as a Frontend Developer, creating accessible user-centric interfaces. As a developer, I like to ensure the quality of code delivery, documentation, and the well-being of the team.

project.title: Projects
project.description: This section shows my most recent projects. They are personal projects that I’ve been developing in my free time. Additionally, they allow me to learn new tools that I actively use in my work. Below is only a small part of my capabilities, knowledge and growth so far. In each project, you will find a description of the project, the design patterns and the technologies used.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: We can keep in touch by email or you can send me a message through this form. Also, I invite you to stay connected and learn more about my work through LinkedIn.
contact.form-email-format: Entered value does not match email format
